intro: Eucosia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan eucosia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant typically features small, clustered flowers and is often found in forested areas with high humidity. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a waxy surface that helps reduce water loss. Eucosia papuana is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
